summary: the breakout groups concluded that it is too soon to tell if SARS can be eradicated. if an animal reservoir of the coronavirus exists, eradication would be very difficult. research priorities include better understanding of epidemiologic parameters of infection and transmission. quarantine, hotlines to report fever, temperature screening in public places, recommendations to travelers, and entry and exit screening at borders. quarantines should ensure financial and psychosocial support and daily needs of the affected persons. one country’s president reportedly proclaimed quarantined persons to be “heroes in the nation’s battle against SARS” major health events to be minimized. of major health events to be minimized.
